data.meanings: by/in/at night (excluding sleep), entered upon or passed the nighttent, house, home Thinking about something and its end resultConcealed or conceived something in the mindA structure of clay or any structure signifying a habitation, an abode or dwelling.Buildings, uninhabited houses, shops, ruins, bazaars, places where the entering is allowed by the owners.Ark of Noah, Mosques, places of worship, Kaabeh or JerusalemA graveHousehold or familyNobilitySudden attack in the night or a surprise attack in the nightRemaining through the night (e.g. bread or water that stays out and becomes stale)
data.sentence: The word الْبَيْتِ comes from the root ب ي ت and is associated with the meanings: by/in/at night (excluding sleep), entered upon or passed the nighttent, house, home Thinking about something and its end resultConcealed or conceived something in the mindA structure of clay or any structure signifying a habitation, an abode or dwelling.Buildings, uninhabited houses, shops, ruins, bazaars, places where the entering is allowed by the owners.Ark of Noah, Mosques, places of worship, Kaabeh or JerusalemA graveHousehold or familyNobilitySudden attack in the night or a surprise attack in the nightRemaining through the night (e.g. bread or water that stays out and becomes stale)

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word رَبَّ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word فَلْيَعْبُدُوا comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
